bug.short_desc: vim-enhanced fails to install due to unsatisfied dependency
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: When attempting to install vim-enhanced an error is raised that vim-common is required but none of the providers can be installed
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): vim-enhanced-2:7.4.1718-1.fc24.x86_64 requires vim-common = 2:7.4.1718-1.fc24
How reproducible: Every time
Steps to Reproduce: 1. sudo dnf install vim-enhanced
Actual results: sudo dnf install vim-common vim-enhanced Last metadata expiration check: 0:48:58 ago on Thu Jun 9 13:28:04 2016. Package vim-common-2:7.4.1868-1.fc24.x86_64 is already installed, skipping. Error: package vim-enhanced-2:7.4.1718-1.fc24.x86_64 requires vim-common = 2:7.4.1718-1.fc24, but none of the providers can be installed (try to add '--allowerasing' to command line to replace conflicting packages)
Expected results: vim-enhanced should be installed
Additional info:
rpm -qa vim-common vim-common-7.4.1868-1.fc24.x86_64
dnf list vim-common Last metadata expiration check: 0:00:11 ago on Thu Jun 9 14:26:25 2016. Installed Packages vim-common.x86_64 2:7.4.1868-1.fc24 @updates-testing
$ sudo dnf list vim-enhanced Last metadata expiration check: 0:05:17 ago on Thu Jun 9 14:23:59 2016. Available Packages vim-enhanced.x86_64 2:7.4.1718-1.fc24 fedora

I was able to fix this issue with:
$ dnf --enablerepo updates-testing install vim-enhanced
Closing
